main_definition: A competition between individuals or groups to see who can complete a certain task, usually involving speed or efficiency, in the shortest possible time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A competitive event where participants run over a specified distance
meanings_and_examples.example: The annual 5K race drew hundreds of athletes from around town.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Competing groups categorized by ethnicity or national origin
meanings_and_examples.example: Race relations between different cultural communities in the city were strained but improving over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A division of people based on physical characteristics such as skin color
meanings_and_examples.example: There is no race when it comes to being human, we are all equal regardless of our appearances.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of moving swiftly from one place to another
meanings_and_examples.example: She had the grace and speed that come with years of practicing dance; she raced across the floor effortlessly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A line or group of people standing close together, often waiting in a queue
meanings_and_examples.example: At the bus stop, there was a long race of commuters lined up for departure.
